goals.question: What is the distribution of population by age group?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of population by age group
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the age distribution of the population and identify any age groups that may require special attention or resources.

goals.question: What is the population density across different regions?
goals.visualization: Choropleth map of population density by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify regions with high population density and understand the distribution of population across different regions.

goals.question: What is the trend of population growth over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of population growth over the years
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the trend of population growth over the years and identify any significant changes or patterns.

goals.question: What is the gender distribution of the population?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the gender distribution of the population and identify any gender imbalances that may require attention.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population by education level?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of population by education level
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the education level distribution of the population and identify any education gaps that may require attention.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('age_group').sum().reset_index()
    sns.barplot(x='age_group', y='population', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population by age group?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['density'] = data['population'] / data['area']
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
    sns.barplot(x='region', y='density', data=data, ax=ax)
    ax.set_xlabel('Region')
    ax.set_ylabel('Population Density')
    ax.axhline(y=data['density'].median(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Median Density: {data["density"].median():.2f}')
    ax.legend()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    sns.lineplot(x='year', y='population', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the trend of population growth over the years?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    gender_counts = data['gender'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(gender_counts, labels=gender_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the gender distribution of the population?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby(['education_level']).sum().reset_index()
    data = data.melt(id_vars=['education_level'], var_name='population', value_name='count')
    sns.barplot(x='education_level', y='count', hue='population', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population by education level?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
